name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: So average precision is computer for

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: one query. But we generally experiment with many

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: different queries and this is to avoid the variance across queries.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Depending on the queries you use you might make different conclusions.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: so it's better then using more queries. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: take the average of the average precision over all these queries.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: So how can we do that?

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Think of just doing arithmetic mean as we

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: this would give us what's called a "Mean Average Position"

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: we take arithmetic mean of all the average precisions over several queries or topics.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _But as I just mentioned in another lecture

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: We talked about the different ways of combining precision and recall.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: And we conclude that the arithmetic mean is not as good as the MAP measure.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: We can also think about the alternative ways of aggregating the numbers.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Let's just also take the arithmetic mean of the average position over

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Let's think about what's the best way of aggregating them.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _If you think about the different ways

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _probably be able to think about another way

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: And we call this kind of average a gMAP.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: once you think about the two different ways. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: do you use MAP or gMAP? _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _Imagine you are again testing a new algorithm in

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: by comparing the ways your old algorithms made the search engine.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Now you've got the average precision for these topics.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Now you are thinking of looking at the overall performance.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: You have to take the average.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: you should also think about the question
column7: well did it make a difference? _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Can you think of scenarios where using one of them would make a difference?

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: That is they would give different rankings of those methods.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: And that also means depending on the way you average or detect the.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: This makes the question becoming even more important.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: if you look at the difference between these. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Different ways of aggregating the average position.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: the sum is dominating by large values. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: So what does large value here mean?

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: It means the query is relatively easy.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Whereas gMAP tends to be affected more by low values.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: And those are the queries that don't have good performance.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Over all the kinds of queries or particular popular queries that might be

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: easy and you want to make the perfect and maybe MAP would be then preferred.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: the answer depends on your users

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: So the point that here is to think about the multiple ways to solve

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column7: and think carefully about the differences. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: And which one makes more sense.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: when one of them might make sense in one situation and _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: another might make more sense in a different situation.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: So it's important to pick out under what situations one is preferred.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _As a special case of the mean average position

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: the case where there was precisely one rank in the document.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column7: in what's called a known item search. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: let's say you have to find Amazon

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: and you hope to find it. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _then your goal is to rank that one particular answer on top

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: you can easily verify the average position

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: will basically boil down to reciprocal rank.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: 1 over r where r is the rank position of that single relevant document. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _So if that document is ranked on the very top or is 1

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _And then we can also take a
column6: a average of all these average precision or _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _reciprocal rank over a set of topics

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: that would give us something called a mean reciprocal rank.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: an problem where you have just one relevant item.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: you can see this r actually is meaningful here. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: And this r is basically indicating how much effort

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: a user would have to make in order to find that relevant document.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _If it's ranked on the top it's low effort that you have to make

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _But if it's ranked at 100 then you actually have to

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: read presumably 100 documents in order to find it.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: in this sense r is also a meaningful measure and the reciprocal rank will _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: So my natural question here is why not simply using r?

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _I imagine if you were to design a ratio to

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: when there is only one relevant item. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: You might have thought about using r directly as the measure.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: think about if you take a average of this over a large number of topics. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Again it would make a difference.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: using 1 over r wouldn't make any difference.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _Larger r with corresponds to a small 1 over r

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _But the difference would only show when
column6: show up when you have many topics. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: think about the average of Mean Reciprocal Rank versus average of just r. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: would this difference change the oath of systems. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column7: there is actually a big difference

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: if you want to think about it and then

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column7: if you take some of our directory

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Again it will be dominated by large values of r.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Those are basically large values that indicate that lower ranked results.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: That means the relevant items rank very low down on the list.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: And the sum that's also the average that would then be dominated by.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: _Where those relevant documents are ranked in

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: in the lower portion of the ranked.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: But from a users perspective we care more about the highly ranked documents.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: So by taking this transformation by using reciprocal rank.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Here we emphasize more on the difference on the top.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: think about the difference between 1 and the 2

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: where and when won't make much difference if you use this.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: But if you use this there will be a big difference in 100 and

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: So this is not the desirable.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: a 1 and 2 won't make much difference. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: So this is yet another case where there may be multiple choices of doing the same

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: thing and then you need to figure out which one makes more sense.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
column6: we showed that the precision-recall curve. _

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: Can characterize the overall accuracy of a ranked list.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: And we emphasized that the actual utility of a ranked list depends

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: on how many top ranked results a user would actually examine.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: An average person uses a standard measure for comparing two ranking methods.

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: It combines precision and recall and

name: 3 - 7 - 2.6 Evaluation of TR Systems- Evaluating Ranked Lists Part 2 (00-10-01) .srt
text: it's sensitive to the rank of every random document.
